data.title: Winery/Vineyard/Brewery Wedding Venues in Virginia - 35 Venues
data.meta_description: Find your dream Winery/Vineyard/Brewery wedding venues in Virginia with Wedding Spot, the only site offering instant price estimates.
data.text:
Where are the best areas to get married in Virginia?

Virginia is known for its rich history, with many historic sites and landmarks available for wedding ceremonies and receptions. Here are some of the best areas to get married in Virginia:

Northern Virginia: This region offers a range of historic sites, vineyards, and country clubs available for weddings. The area is also conveniently located near Washington, D.C., and several major airports.

Charlottesville: This area is known for its stunning natural beauty, including the Blue Ridge Mountains and Shenandoah National Park. Charlottesville also has several historic buildings and vineyards available for weddings.

Coastal Virginia: This area offers several beautiful beaches and waterfront venues available for weddings, including Virginia Beach and the Chesapeake Bay.

Ultimately, the best area for your wedding will depend on your personal preferences and the style of wedding you're looking to have. These areas are a great place to start your search for the perfect wedding location.

How much do wedding venues cost in Virginia?

On average, wedding venues in Virginia can range anywhere from $3,000 to $25,000 or more. Outdoor venues such as parks and golf courses are generally less expensive than indoor venues like historic buildings and cultural centers.

Virginia has a state sales tax rate of 5.3%. Local taxes may also apply, and some venues may charge additional fees.

Where can wedding guests stay in Virginia?

Looking for no-fuss options for your guests? Virginia offers a range of lodging options for wedding guests, including:

Hotels and Resorts: Virginia has several hotels and resorts available for wedding guests, including chain hotels like Marriott and Hilton.

Bed and Breakfasts: Virginia also has several charming bed and breakfasts available for wedding guests, including historic homes and estates. These accommodations typically offer a more personalized and intimate experience for guests.

Vacation Rentals: For larger groups or families, vacation rentals can be a great option.

Campgrounds and RV Parks: For guests who prefer the outdoors, Virginia has several camping and RV parks available, including state and national parks.

Wedding Spot can also help you find hotels and set up room blocks for you and your guests near your desired venue. When choosing accommodations for your guest, consider proximity to the wedding venues, amenities offered, price, and transportation options.

When is the best time of year to get married in Virginia?

Virginia has a moderate climate, with mild winters and warm summers. The most popular months for weddings in Virginia are typically May through October, when the weather is warm and dry. However, keep in mind that the weather can be unpredictable, and it's a good idea to have a backup plan in case of rain or other inclement weather.

What other information do couples need to know about getting married in Virginia?

Getting married in Virginia can be a wonderful experience but to make sure everything goes smoothly, keep in mind the following:

Marriage License: To legally marry in Virginia, you need to obtain a marriage license from a Virginia Circuit Court Clerk's Office. Both parties need to be present and provide identification such as a driver's license or passport. There is a fee for the marriage license, and there is no waiting period.

Transportation: Virginia is located on the East Coast of the United States and is accessible by several major airports, including Dulles International Airport and Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport. Transportation may be needed for guests traveling from out of town. Virginia also has a range of transportation options available, including rental cars, shuttles, and private car services.

Don't hesitate to reach out to local officials or wedding professionals if you have any questions or concerns along the way.
